text: Adolph Robert Thornton Jr. (July 27, 1985 â€“ November 17, 2021), better known by his stage name Young Dolph, was an American rapper. == Biography == In February 2016, Dolph released his first studio album, King of Memphis. It peaked at number 49 on the Billboard 200 chart. He was featured on O.T. Genasis' hit single "Cut It". The song peaked at number 35 on the Billboard Hot 100. Dolph was shot multiple times outside of a local retail store in Los Angeles on September 26, 2017. He received multiple gunshots wounds which upon being hospitalized were being treated as non-life threatening. A few hours later, Young Dolph was being treated under critical condition. == Murder == On November 17, 2021, Thornton Jr. was gunned down while at a cookie store in Memphis, Tennessee. He was 36 years old. Four people were arrested. 23-year- old Justin Johnson, 32-year-old Cornelius Smith, 27-year-old Shundale Barnett, and 43-year-old Hernandez Govan. In June 2023, Jemarcus Johnson agreed to a plea deal to plead guilty to three counts of accessory after-the-fact to have the conspiracy to murder charge dropped from his charges. Johnson is expected to testify against the others at the other suspects upcoming trials. On September 26, 2024, a judge found Justin Johnson guilty on all counts and sentenced him to life in prison. Both Smith and Govan still await trail. ==References== Category:1985 births Category:2021 deaths Category:2021 murders in the United States Category:Rappers from Illinois Category:African-American rappers Category:American crime victims Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:Musicians from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Murders by firearm in the United States Category:Murdered African-American people Category:Rappers from Tennessee Category:American trap musicians Category:Gangsta rappers
title: Young Dolph
